page.title: 12FARMING IN THE AREA 2
page.content: A movement book is kept by all farmers to enable the Misistry of Agriculture veterinary surgeons to trace the origin and destination of all livestock movement in the event of any outbreak of a notifiable disease such as anthrax or foot and mouth. Pheasants are reared in large numbers for organised shoots, which take place from October to the end of January, attracting wealthy landowners and businessmen from all over the country (including some Royalty). This year the Spring was reasonably dry and warm which gave the crops a good start but the summer was cold and wet, which made harvest late and prolonged. Summer weather finally arrived in October with temperatures reaching record levels.
